snippet.title: Mars ticket deadline nears for someone with the right stuff
snippet.description: As more than 165,000 people apply to join the Mars One mission, CEO Bas Lansdorp outlines his company's timeline for picking its astronauts.

snippet.title: Fatwa forbids Muslims from traveling to Mars
snippet.description: The Mars One project plans to send a crew of colonists to the Red Planet in about 10 years, but Muslims may have to defy a religious edict to make the trip.

snippet.title: All aboard for Mars, just $500,000 a ticket
snippet.description: SpaceX founder Elon Musk tells the BBC that he's figured out a way to get passengers to the Red Planet for just half a million dollars each and that he'll unveil his plan soon.

snippet.title: Move over, Mars: Manned Europa mission considered
snippet.description: A group that calls itself Objective Europa is investigating the feasibility of sending a one-way manned mission to Jupiter's moon Europa.

snippet.title: Will Mars colonists live in robot-dug caves like these?
snippet.description: Fancy hunkering down in a basalt cavern on the Red Planet? On the menu in this vision by a German architecture firm: lots of asparagus.

snippet.title: Didn't win Apple's WWDC ticket lottery? You might still be in luck
snippet.description: Apple faithful this year had to enter a lottery to buy a ticket to the company's annual developer confab. But the unlucky ones may still get be able to buy a ticket.

snippet.title: NASA's idea of a Mars ‘reality show’
snippet.description: What happens when you stick six wannabe astronauts in crammed quarters in the middle of nowhere for months? A NASA-funded study seeks to find out.

snippet.title: Why I want to live in space: Mars One book to show human side
snippet.description: With its upcoming book of essays and applicant letters, the nonprofit trying to colonize Mars seeks a deeper, more communal understanding about what it may be like to travel to the Red Planet and never come back.

snippet.title: Happy Valentine's Day, from Mars
snippet.description: For three (Martian) years, NASA has been collecting images of heart-shaped features on the Red Planet. Here they are, just in time for Valentine's Day.

snippet.title: Mysterious light in Mars image sparks curiosity
snippet.description: UFO enthusiasts are excited about a strange blip of light in a photo from Mars, but the real explanation is likely much less exotic than alien life.
